intro: Pleurothallis alpestris, commonly known as the alpine pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the Andean highlands. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features slender, wiry stems and lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with a subtle fragrance, and are clustered in small inflorescences. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized plant within the orchid family.
